title: 喂喂 香港嘅酒吧佬 入一入黎

replies.msg:
致香港市民：
我們是一群熱愛香港的調酒師，想藉此表達對香港人的支持和對政府團隊的不滿。
一直以來，我們酒吧行業甚至整個服務業的一大宗旨，是以重視每一位客人並盡力滿足其需求為依歸。但政府服務香港市民的態度令人擔憂。自六月九號的百萬人大遊行，以致延伸而來的一連串反送中示威行動遍地開花，當中更有年輕人以死明志都未能得到政府正面回應，我們感到無力和痛心。
再者，於七月二十一日元朗發生的暴力襲擊事件，香港警方遲遲未能到場控制情況，令西鐵站出現長達39分鐘的冇政府狀態，令多名無辜市民及記者受傷。更甚，政府在翌日的記者招待會上暗示塗鴉國徽相比元朗市民人身安全更為重要，令我們不禁對政府的管治態度失去信心，逐漸質疑整個政府團隊是否有足夠能力和熱誠去服務香港市民，還是服務的是另有其人。
我們自知自身影響力有限，但我們想向所有仍在堅持的香港人打氣！香港人加油！！
五大訴求，缺一不可！
光復香港，時代革命!

留底你嘅相 講出你嘅訴求 俾尼個政府睇到

To Hong Kong,

We are a group of bartenders who precious Hong Kong as our city, our home, is extremely disappointed by the policies our government deployed and concerned the current climate of violence against citizens in Hong Kong.
Our profession, among the hospitality industry, commits to always put people in first priority by pursuing excellent mixology showmanship. In the past two months, we walked side by side with millions in marches, we had the same sleepless nights following news and discussions on countless telegram groups, and we mourned the loss of lives together.

We demand the government to take responsibility and react to the loss of trust between the Hong Kong residents and the administration, the threatened international prestige of Hong Kong, the damage of Hong Kong citizens’ core human rights in this period of turmoil.

We criticize the police’s misconduct and neglect of duty displayed to the Yuen Long attack of passengers and journalists in an MTR station on 21 st July 2019, was unacceptable and abnormal leading to a 39 minutes state of lawfulness in the area and numerous injuries of the innocents. The officer-in-charge should be thoroughly investigated for any disciplinary offence and supervisory accountability for their failure to stop the violent attack.

To our further disappointment and anger, CE Carrie Lam spoke out on Monday started with condemns the defacing protest at the China Liaison Office, priories on Yuen Long attacks. Whom descript as 'shocking' and refuse to characterise as 'riot', appeared hinting the safety of hong kong citizen weight much less than a national emblem. We witnessed our government had refused to listen to the public and act, violating its position of serving the citizens.

If Lam truly wants to restore our trust, she just needs to meet our five humble demands:
- to withdraw the now-suspended extradition bill completely
- investigate the police’s decision to fire weapons at protesters
- stop all prosecutions against protesters
- retract the classification of “rioting” on June 12 clashes between protesters and police outside the Legislative Council building.
- justice chief Teresa Cheng Yeuk-wah, security chief John Lee Ka-chiu and police commission Stephen Lo Wai-chung to step down.

HK Bartenders, Vanguards of Freedom
